en.bdb: Kshatriyas began to serve the Brahmin and the Vaishyas considered the Kshatriyas as gods.838.

verse.unicode: ਜਹ ਕੋਈ ਕਹੈ ਤਹੀ ਵਹ ਧਾਵੈ ॥

en.bdb: The Shudras began to serve all and they went wherever they were sent

en.bdb: Ram ruled by killing the tyrants like Ravana, by emancipating different devotees and attendants (ganas) and by collecting the taxes of Lanka.840.

en.bdb: In this way, Ram ruled for a long time and on one day Kaushalya breathed her last on the bursting of her nerve Brahm-Randhra.841.

en.bdb: Many rituals were performed for the salvation of the mother and by that time Kaikeyi had also passed away.

transliteration.english: yaa ko kachh raavan so hotaa ||
transliteration.hindi: या को कछु रावन सो होता ॥
transliteration.en: yaa ko kachh raavan so hotaa ||
transliteration.hi: या को कछु रावन सो होता ॥
transliteration.ipa: jɑ kɔ kəɕ rɑʋən sɔ hɔt̪ɑ.
transliteration.ur: ےا کو کچھ راون سو هوتا ۔۔

en.bdb: She (Sita) must have had some love for Ravana, that is the reason why she is looking at his portrait drawn by her

en.bdb: “If Ram the king Raghu clan abides ever in my heart, in my speech and action then,

en.bdb: O mother earth! you give me some place and merge me in yourself.”846.

verse.unicode: ਰਘੁਬਰ ਬਿਨੁ ਸੀਅ ਨਾ ਜੀਐ ਸੀਅ ਬਿਨ ਜੀਐ ਨ ਰਾਮ ॥੮੪੮॥

en.bdb: Sita could not live without Ram and it is impossible for Ram to remain alive without Sita.848.

en.bdb: Ram said to Lakshman, “You sit on the gate and do not let anyone to come in.” Ram himself went into the palace and abandoning his body left this abode of death.849.
